revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: An essay towards an English grammar. With a dissertation on the nature and peculiar use of certain hypothetical verbs, in the English language. (By John Fell). (Lo..."
revision.text: Possibly: An essay towards an English grammar. With a dissertation on the nature and peculiar use of certain hypothetical verbs, in the English language. (By John Fell). (London : Printed for C. Dilly, in the Poultry, M DCC LXXXIV. [1784]). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2488779~S1 or An essay towards a practical English grammar. Describing the genius and nature of the English tongue: giving likewise a rational and plain account of grammar in general, with a familiar explanation of its terms. By James Greenwood. (London : Printed for R. Tooket, and are sold by Samuel Keeble at the Turks-Head in Fleet-Street, John Lawrence at the Angel in the Poultrey, Jonah Bowyer at the Rose in Ludgate Street, R. and I. Bonwick at the Red-Lyon in Paul's Church-Yard and Rob. Halsey at the Plow and Harrow in Cornhill, 1711). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2488750~S1
